title: Reinvigorating America's Beautiful Clean Coal Industry and Amending Executive Order 14241

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to promote and expand the domestic coal industry by reducing regulatory barriers, increasing coal production and exports, and supporting coal use in emerging technologies like artificial intelligence data centers and steel manufacturing. It also updates policies to designate coal as a critical mineral and accelerate coal technology development while amending a prior executive order to incorporate coal fully in national mineral priorities.
potential_concerns: Accelerating coal production and reducing environmental reviews may lead to increased environmental degradation and harm to local ecosystems.
Rescinding policies that discourage coal investment could undermine efforts to transition to cleaner energy sources and worsen climate change impacts.
Efforts to expand coal-powered infrastructure for AI data centers may conflict with sustainability goals and raise concerns among green technology advocates.
Changes to federal leasing and royalty policies could face legal challenges and administrative delays impacting timely implementation.
Increased coal exports may strain geopolitical relations with countries seeking cleaner energy commitments and affect global climate cooperation.
